comment: Professor Widener is very passionate about history, and he does a great job at teaching the subject. Attendance is required, and he is pretty lecture heavy. The midterm and final are not easy, so studying for those is necessary. Every thing else was not too bad for me, but most of the online quizzes did require the LockDown Browser.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Amazing lectures--Caring

comment: Professor Widener realllyyyyy cares about history. He lectures the whole time. D2L quizzes are difficult w/ lockdown browser and webcam, but sometimes he would count attendance as a quiz which helps. He lets you use a cheat sheet on the midterm. If you take really good notes, easy B, possible A.
rating_tags: Respected--Skip class? You won't pass.--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: He made me love history! He's funny and will keep you engaged. Amazing guy. Classes are lecture heavy with lots of material but he's happy to stay with you after class. You need to actually come to class, group chats will save your life. Quizzes are HARD so he sometimes takes attendance for a quiz. Lets you have a cheat sheet for midterm and final.
rating_tags: ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--Hilarious--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: Great lecturer- very passionate about the subject. If you care about this sort of stuff, definitely take him. He'll gladly explain things into more detail.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Participation matters--Clear grading criteria

comment: This class is lecture heavy but Mr. Widener is a great professor and actually makes history class not boring for a change. He isn't a tough grader and is very passionate about this subject.
rating_tags: Hilarious--Amazing lectures--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: Professor Widener is an excellent teacher. He's really passionate about history and it definitely shows. The reviews that reflect negatively on him are partly due to people who expect to get an easy A just because he's a professor for a Ged Ed course. He's understanding, just talk to him after or before class, do your work, get an A. It's not hard.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Inspirational--Caring

comment: Very boring and awkward guy. Doesn't respond to emails. Felt like he just wanted to get the class over with. Harder than history should be. Impossible to get an A. I got a B and tried. Short answer is graded extremely hard for no reason. Everything with lockdown browser. Try to avoid,
rating_tags: Tough Grader

comment: If you want early onset arthritis in your hand, take this class. Lectures are content heavy, boring, and the full 75 minutes. There are two papers with unclear instructions, weekly online quizzes using Lockdown browser, and a midterm and final which are comprised of multiple choice (fine) and several short answers (caused ample stress). Don't take.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Skip class? You won't pass.--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: He is an extremely fair professor. His tests and quizzes are hard, but he is more than willing to give extra credit. Everyday he lectures, but they are interesting and his powerpoint are easy to follow. You get multiple attempts on your quizzes and midterm/final. Overall, he is a great professor who truly does care about his students.
rating_tags: ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--Tests? Not many--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: Super lecture heavy; be prepared to take good notes! There were only two tests, the midterm and the final, and they were pretty long and detailed. He gives you time to prepare though as well as extra credit. Overall, pretty okay class, and I would take again.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--EXTRA CREDIT--Tests are tough

comment: Interesting content. The multiple choice/ quizzes are online through a lockdown browser (that records you via webcam), terrible site. Takes attendance but in the end counts as 0% of final grade in D2L. Not worth the trouble. Grades extremely hard on midterm short answer & essays. Harder than it could be. Doesnt respond well to emails.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--BEWARE OF POP QUIZZES--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: Mr. Widener is a nice guy who is genuinely interested in what he does and in your wellbeing. He can be super disorganized at times. The quizzes are pretty hard: some easy, some a little impossible. Usually he recognizes this and gives a lot of extra credit, and a lot of help, and takes what you want into consideration. Not a bad class but not easy.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Tests? Not many--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: Passionate about the subject, he gets into what he's talking about. Even if it might be boring, he talks about it like it's interesting. There are a lot of quizzes but you get multiple attempts at them. The test's multiple choice was hard but the short answer helped out my grade. Nice guy, the class is kind of boring at times but it wasn't too bad.
rating_tags: Tests? Not many--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: He is good at teaching. He grades extremely hard on papers and short answer. Be prepared to spend around 8 hours on the midterm in one day and even more on final. You have to use lockdown browser while taking quizzes but he gives multiple attempts. I have worked really hard in this class and I am struggling to get an A.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Get ready to read

comment: Widener is a super approrpiate name for Dr Widener as he really widens your thinking.  I cam into this class thinking it would be awful but the man is amazing and is really willing work with you one on one.  He's kind of a flirt bu pretty harmless (pretty sure he's gay) and you will learn so much from him
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Inspirational--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS

comment: Really just a bad professor I think. Can't disagree with him on a topic, said things that were just flat out false but nobody disagreed in class because he's pretty much a major hippie(if you're into that kind of thing take him). Quizzes and tests online were hard. Does discussion boards online that are major grade, but not hard.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Gives good feedback--LOTS OF HOMEWORK

comment: He is very passionate about his lectures which is amazing because I hate history and he made it pretty interesting. Attendance is mandatory but even if it wasnt you couldnt pass without listening to his lectures. In order to get an A you do have to read the book but if you dont you can pass with a B. I would for sure take him again! Truly cares
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: It certainly shows through his teaching that he likes history, and I found it easy to follow unlike others. He explains things very well and sometimes provides examples or gets the class involved to better understand things. To get an A and a good understanding though I feel like you really need to read the textbook but that is very time consuming.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Skip class? You won't pass.--Inspirational

comment: He is a new professor and is passionate about history, but he teaches as if we are all history majors and already have a working knowledge on the topics he teaches. He is not clear about his grading or what to do on assignments or when they are due.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--SO MANY PAPERS--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: Professor Widener was a pretty good professor. He was not the professor I signed up for, as KSU switched me to him at the last minute, but he proved to be a pretty good history professor. He's actually passionate about what he talks about, but his tests can be somewhat challenging. I wrote 4 papers for his class, all 2-3 pages. He's a decent choice
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Hilarious--Amazing lectures

comment: Just avoid this professor. He makes everything difficult. Take somebody and save yourself.

Very difficult class. He is hard to follow along with and he treats this class like everyone in it is a history major instead of it just being a gen ed class. Unless history is your major and you really enjoy and understand it, do not take his class.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.--LECTURE HEAVY
